title.narrative: Appui à une réponse rapide d’urgence pour l’accès aux services WASH, d’éducation de qualité pour les enfants et à l’assistance en abris d’urgence et biens non alimentaires (ABNA) pour les populations déplacées dans les régions de Tahoua, Diffa et de Till

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to safe lives and ensure the well-being of displaced people by improving their access to drinking water, hygiene and sanitation in the Tillabéri region, provide access to quality education for children in the Tillabéri and Tahoua regions, and provide appropriate shelter/NFI response in the Tillaberi, Tahoua and Diffa regions. This UNICEF project provides, among other services, 3,000 emergency shelters as well as shelter construction kits benefiting the most vulnerable people; access to water, hygiene and sanitation including construction of 350 emergency latrines and showers, as well as access to the minimum WASH package for 5,000 children; and emergency education assistance including the construction of 32 temporary learning spaces and 32 emergency latrines, respectively. 21,000 people will be targeted with Shelter/NFI assistance; 19,000 people with lifesaving WASH assistance; and 6,936 people with education support.
